description: Doordashed a wet buche burrito and the camarones a la diabla burrito. The burritos were really big and had generous amounts of meat. The a la diabla was amazing! Huge shrimp and lots of them. Caution it is a little soupier, saucy on the inside, but the flavors and spice were amazing. It all came with a side of sour cream and guacamole which was cool. Only negative was that the chips were an extra $1. Will definitely be trying this place again.
author: Jeanette H.

description:
By far the worst restaurant to order from via Eat24/Grubhub.

5 stars to the Grubhub delivery man and Grubhub customer service, when the restaurant refused to honor a missing soup from my order. The order was initially for 2 caldo de res (beef soup). The delivery guy delivered our food and immediately stated that the restaurant had told him they had already "called and spoke with the customer." 

Indeed, the restaurant did call me to say they only had enough caldo de res to fulfill one order, not the two orders I had placed. They had chicken the girl said. I asked if they had menudo. No. So I confirmed one order of caldo de res and one order of caldo de pollo.

Instead, what I got was one caldo de res and one taco. The delivery man offered to go back to the restaurant if we called the restaurant and asked them to make another soup order. The delivery guy even called the restaurant on his own phone. When asked if they could make a caldo de pollo for him to pick up, the woman refused (a different woman than the one who called me), saying that Grubhub would charge the restaurant for another delivery. The woman then asked us to hang up with the driver's phone, stated she had to clear it with her boss first, and would call me back on my cellphone. I immediately called Grubhub customer service on my phone, while the delivery guy continued to wait to see if he needed to go back to the restaurant. 

Grubhub CS spoke to the driver when I told them the driver was still waiting, then put me on hold and called the restaurant. A few minutes later, CS came back onto the phone with me, telling me that the "boss" outright refused to call (get on the phone with?) Eat24 or Grubhub to make the order right. Not sure if they got this information from the woman I was dealing with, the same one who stated she had to get the OK from the boss. Both Grubhub CS and the delivery driver stated the restaurants claim that they would be charged again for delivery was false. 

After the 15 minute fiasco, Grubhub CS opted to refund me for the one missing soup order, and told me to tell the delivery guy that he could leave to finish his other deliveries. Grubhub CS also stated he was quite disappointed in the restaurant, and apologized to both me and the driver for the inconvenience. I asked Grubhub CS if there was a way of flagging the restaurant for other customers to know of the shady business practice, or at a minimum, the outright refusal to remedy the situation (offer the refund yourself! Or offer a dish at the equivalent price! DON'T refuse to get on the phone to fix the problem!) at which time CS stated I should leave a review for future customers to be informed of the bad experience, thus this review.

Shortly after I hung up with Grubhib CS, the woman at the restaurant called me back, saying Grubhub refunded my order. I'm not sure if she called to finally make it right, or was calling to protest the refund, but the way she was speaking sounding as though a protest was going to be made. I informed her she could take it up with Grubhub. She made a pffft and hung up.

The taquiera is completely unprofessional and unethical. My apologies to the poor driver who had to wait, and for any fellow Eat24/Grubhub customers' orders that may have been delayed as a result of this restuarant's unprofessionalism.
author: N M.

description:
The food is fast, but can be greasy. 
Not the best Mexican food you can get in this area.
author: Alejandra A.

description:
Well after reading other reviews from customers about their experience I can't believe that so many people had horrible experience. Well I had great experience the cashier was friendly understood exactly what I wanted to order was very helpful. Haven't been here maybe in 8 years they remodel looks nicer the food a little bit more expensive than it was I ordered the super $8 carne asada quesadilla suiza which is more than enough for me to make two meals out of. 
As you walk into the right they have tables& tables in the back they have all the fresh salsa all the little side stuff in the front, and they make homemade fresh chips with no salt which I like that.
 The service was fast done right and the restaurant was clean So in all I had a great experience next time I'm in the area getting my eye exam I'll try something else.
 (Thanks for reading my review!) Lizzie
author: Lizzie G.

description:
Overall, food is average. Nothing special to write about. The thing was that I ordered a burrito with specific instructions conveyed in English and Spanish, the cashier did not listen. She claims that although I ordered the burrito without rice or beans that 'ALL BURRITOS HAVE RICE AND BEANS'. Yeah, don't care about that, but having to remake a burrito THREE TIMES, that's all bad. 

Might not come back to this location, but if you don't care how your order is made, this is the place for you.
author: A B.

description: I've been going to this place for hot minute now. They're decent most of the time but recently the lady in the afternoon has been forgetting the sour cream for my nachos/nacho fries (since they sometimes pack it on the side on some days for some reason). I don't check since I usually have faith on people. Have you tried eating a dried nachos/nacho fries?! Not cool.
author: Lex Marc T.

description:
I have ordered through door dash with them multiple times. Their food is AMAZING!!!!  I LOOOOOVE their mole sauce. Literally crave it. I ordered lunch and I have no mole!!!!! Devastation!!!! 

I'm sure they were prob busy given it's lunch time but guys, how did you miss the mole sauce???
author: Sara O.

description: Ive tried many burritos at diffrent taquerias, i ordered a steak and shrimp burrito and it was really good! Better than i expected! they have a habanero salsa thats also really delicious, spicy but really good! I really recomend this place
author: Hinojosa J.

description:
So I always pass by this place but I've never went, so I decided last night to give it a try. 

Let's just say that I haven't confirmed my email for my yep account in 5 years and I've now decided to do so to give this place a review.

This place is absolute TRASH 

Me and my gf ordered a Cali burrito w/ lengua and a super burrito w/ carne asada. 
1. The insides all look like mush - everything is soggy and the flavors are gross
2. Did I even get lengua? Both of our burritos had the same meat, but the meat was so gross you couldn't even tell if it was carne asada or lengua. Looked more like canned cubed steak if that's even a thing
3. The prices are not the same as listed online. The food here sucks so much, I definitely feel like I wasted my money on the food.

In all, there are a ton of other place right around the area that you are much better spending your time and money to go to.

I'm saving you from yourself right now, do not go here. If you do, you'll look back at my review and think to yourself, "I should've listened..."
author: Jonathan C.

description: This is my go to taqueria, especially since I live in the neighborhood. Their super suiza is good and not badly priced. Their burritos are also tasty.
author: Becky Mae A.

description: I'm sorry, but carne asada tossed onto a corn tortilla is not a taco. There was nothing else on there, not cilantro, no onions, no nothing. The carnitas burrito had a couple hunks of pork that were huge and the meat was super tough. They hadn't bothered to chop it up. There was mostly rice with that in what was supposed to be a super burrito, it was a super boring burrito. We've ordered from here before and had better. Is it going down hill? I might not really want to find out. It wasn't good...
author: Debbie B.

description: I like this place, but I can't say I love the place. I ordered the steak nachos and yes, it was loaded with toppings. I have to admit that I didn't get a chance to finish the entire thing because it's just more than I expected. My mother ordered tacos and she said they were good. They have a salsa bar and the options are all good. They are nice people and their food meets the guilty pleasure factor, so I would recommend for the cheaper prices on a full meal.
author: Merrilyn W.

description: Always great food. Sometimes the wait can be long but well worth it. It's close by and convenient by public transportation. Hate that it's next door to a smoke shop but hey, it is what it is.
author: Monica B.

description: I don't recommend this place to eat.  The lady who takes the orders prepares and packs the food for you without wearing any gloves nor washing her hands.  When confronted about this health violations she was very rude and stated "if you don't like to eat bacteria, why don't you go home and cook" This place lacks customer service and is in violation of the health codes.
author: Mario U.

description:
Worst customer experience ever! 

I ordered through yelp and the dumb ass lady at the cashier said I didn't pay and she wanted to retake my order which was stupid! I showed her my order confirmation on the app and she continued to deny that I didn't pay! After this I knew that my order was going to be messed up!

Which eventually happened.. I ordered a steak and shrimp super burrito and they forgot to put the steak in it! Whatta joke! The other food I ordered was totally messed up as well! The quesadillas were all messy and the other burrito I ordered had rice when I said no rice! 

Never going here again! Period!
author: Richard V.

description:
I finally had a chance to stop by this sweet spot and it was very very good decision. So very nice establishment lots of open tables and the menu is right to your left as you enter the restaurant. I came here looking for a good meal for lunch and I found that in the burritos. I wanted up getting a Super Burrito with the Carnitas and that my friends was a really really good choice. The wait wasn't too long either.

The meat in the burrito was cooked perfectly. All the toppings went really well with the burrito. Oh, I also got the order that which was on point at this place. They also have the salsa station over to the side if you want to get some salsa verde or some Pico De gallo.

If you're looking for parking there's plenty of street parking and as well as parking in the residential neighborhood. Also be cautious of crossing the street trying to get here because some cars do not stop.

The people who work here are really really friendly. This place is very welcome and very inviting and that do have TVs I mean ATV for watching sports and such so that's an incentive to come here and get home and check it out.

I highly recommend this place if you live in the area or just visiting or are looking for a nice Taqueria go to in the area. Kudos to this place because they do a really good job. They make for a good stop if it's around lunchtime.

This place has my stamp of approval as a quality Taqueria and that's all I'm going to say about that.

#keepitup
author: Robert F.

description: Don't ever go here. This place is joke. Came here to order dinner. Waited for 15 minute and discovered they didn't even place my order in the kitchen. One staff lie about my order was ready on the counter when there was nothing there, dude is seeing things. The staff have poor communication skills, yelling at each other in front of customers. Save your money and order somewhere else.
author: Linda W.

description:
Did you guys change the cooks? 
They put hot sauce in my beef taco which is not supposed to have hot sauce and I hate hot sauce, and they made my cheese quesadilla into a cheese burrito quesadilla, horrible! It was also undercooked and the cheese was still cold because it was so thick. This is the last time I come to this place, I will find a new late night spot for Mexican food.
author: Sam T.

description: Burritos are delicious! My only problem is when I order the prawn burrito or prawn anything I always have the take off the shell or the legs. It would be nice to just eat a burrito without having to dig through to check if the prawns have shells. Other than that the food is definitely yummy!
author: Arcel M.

description: I order their nacho fries for delivery a lot.  However, they are not consistent with the ingredients they put in it.  Sometimes you get guacamole and sour cream, other times you don't.  I guess it depends on who makes it.  Tonight I decided to order "extra" guacamole, sour cream and cheese.  I got 1-1/2 of an avocado on the side, no sour cream but lots of cheese.  I'll need to see where else I can get nacho fries.
author: Venus B.

description: As mentioned in a previous review, this place has fallen off hard! We usually have had good luck ordering  late night burritos off Uber Eats and fairly regular customers. Made the mistake of ordering lunch the other day. They very clearly gave us re-heated food from the night before.. it was nasty inedible slop.. refused a refund. No Mas!  We are done with these guys.
author: Vince S.

description: We had food delivered last night. The most disgusting crap ever. Sent us the wrong order but the real insult was the dry, tastelessness, did I say dry, cold crappy food. So sad.
author: victoria c.

description: I ordered food from this Restaurant via doordash. I ordered crispy carne asada flautas. When I opend the container to look at my flautas each flauta literally had two marble-sized, burnt pieces of meat and nothing else. So basically I paid for rice,beans, and crispy tortillas with virtually no meat. Taking this restaurant off my doordash list.
author: Laura W.

description: 12 dollars for this?? Each taco had 4 pieces of shrimp each and that's three tacos and the shrimp is small as hell? Wtf. Never again
author: Mark S.

description: Horrible, just horrible. Raw food and hair found, didn't even get too eat anything else ,killed my appetite , NEVER EATING FROM HERE AGAIN
author: Elaine R.

description: Wow. I have never been so upset after ordering a California burrito. Absolute trash. Couldn't believe I spent $10 on this. This place should be charged with robbery by stealing all their customers money while handing out the most screwed up food Id ever had. I had all my friends take a bite of my food because I couldn't believe how bad my only bite tasted. Id much rather shove my face in a pile of dirt that's layered with dog piss than eat here again. Good gawd. Terrible
author: Matthew K.

description:
I ordered the pollo baby burrito (the total came to just about $6). If this is their baby burrito, I can't even imagine the size of the normal burrito. From the few taquerias I've gone to, I've noticed an ongoing trend: lack of flavor. The first bite into the burrito is usually the most bland because of the tortilla but nope. I got plenty of stuff in my bite. The chicken was flavorful and worked deliciously well with the salsa, rice and cheese that was inside. 

The chips and salsa are pretty delicious there too. The cashier handed me three little cups with a look on her face. Honey, I know that these are for the salsa bar. 

The cashier was pleasant and friendly. I don't get a feeling of being the odd one out in the restaurant because it is located right behind the bus stop on Mission and Geneva. It's also super easy to get to because of all of the buses that run by there(8,43,14,14R, maybe I'm missing a couple burn these are the main ones)
author: Connie C.

description: Meat was dry no flavor. Never again. Incomplete order thru doordash, missed one order. Ordered over $50 worth of tacos and quesadillas and no salsa on any of them. Not even a single slice of lime. I called to let them know that they missed one quesadilla and I was dismissed immediately. Terrible food, terrible service, go somewhere else. SKIP this place. Thumbs down. Zero star
author: Sabra T.

description: Authentic Mexican food . Convenient and quick . They made my food really fast and I was happy with my results. The prices are average; not expensive nor cheap.
author: Shanice C.

description: Chicharrones were nasty, they tasted like they were made with rancid oil and left to sit for a month.
author: s b.

description: I love this place, their salsa is great, their meat is great, the portions are huge and don't even get me started on their beans. Also, they have the best prices for Mexican food in Excelsior area and they're open till 2am most nights. Definitely try their nachos and if you are like me and don't wanna hate yourself after eating a big burrito, get their Baby burrito which is just as awesome but a bit smaller.
author: Atieh G.

description: Lies, this food is disgusting now. Their food is not consistent probably due to the fact they have different cooks all the time. They meat is chewy and their food is salty. They need to go back to a couple years ago when it was actually worth going there.
author: Bob B.

description:
Poor me, right?  It takes a lot to make me write a bad review, because any bad press drives down business.  The last thing a long established Mom and Pop owned kind of place needs is negative feedback, but after many years of getting food at Blue Iguana, my overall experience can only be called negative.  Worst of all, it's because they're socially disconnected. If it was just the food, I might not even bother to write a review. 

I used to work in the neighborhood and get food there after a long day of driving, and I'm still in the area several times a week.  Good thing El Pollo Supremo is right around the corner, I say.  They're the opposite: almost always good. 

Iguana Azul started out good.  This was probably 15 years ago.  Then it was like they changed owners or something, or stopped caring about who they hired.  Over time I saw cooks who clearly didn't care about what they were doing.  Cashiers were almost always friendly, polite and even attractive ladies, but the food got worse and worse. 

When before the burritos used to be fresh, not sloppy and poorly put together, the last three times I have gone over a stretch of 3-4 months, but also long before that, I got probably the worst burritos I've ever had, and I was born and raised in the city.  I have had the best burritos and Mexican food, and at Blue Iguana, now I have had the worst.  Undercooked chicken?  Over cooked?  Scrap meat and grease piled from the grill?  Tons of water in the salsa?  Old ass guac?  Way too hot?  Torn flour tortillas and you still shoved a burrito together?  Check all of the above.  

But even worse, and likely related to all of the above?  Yeah, I'm gonna go there: the gringo treatment... when the cook sees who he's making it for and does the worst job he can, on purpose. Yeah, I'm a white guy.  Yeah, white privilege is a thing, especially in San Francisco (only since tech culture came up), but I'm not that guy.  I'm not one of the guys guiltily pretending to fit in and dressing down like I could be from here and I didn't out earn for your apartment, which magically became a condo. I'm a blue collar worker who has worked with people of every background and kind  for many years.  You think I don't know it when I see it?  I don't like the way white privilege is shaking down in the city or the Bay Area either, but I'm not going to take it out on you because you look like one of them.  Why did this restaurant?  Somebody wasn't paying attention to the character of the people they hired, or if they did, they took a wrong turn somewhere themselves.  

So I ban myself from Blue Iguana, boycott them by telling my friends why they should pass and now I have made my voice heard more publicly.  I hope you will take this into consideration before you pay them a visit.  My mistake was going back when the food kept getting worse and worse... for what?  No reason?  You can't fool me.  They deserve no stars.
author: Jackson B.

description: They are falling off hard a/f it is not even funny. I am for San Francisco so hear me out. I'm writing this because I'm finally fed up. Every single time I've there in the past few months they've gotten every thing wrong. I order a burrito with WHOLE beans and they gave me refried beans. They need to clean up their act NOW!
author: Orlando C.

description: I am really dissapointed of this place delivery service excellent but the food shabby ...
author: Raphael S.

description:
Muy bien!

The Mission District is always all kinds of sketch and bullcockery. But I grew up around here so the holes-in-the-wall eateries always get to me the most.

This is one of em.

Located along Geneva, this place sits next to a local liquor store and the bus stop. Not the best location to be at, but it still gets some good business.

The usual here:
- Super nachos: The nachos are SUPER. They are very generous with the amount of errythang that you get (salsa, guacamole, chips, your choice of meat, sour cream, cheese). The meat is cooked on spot so it's nice and hot when you get em and the cheese is melted so you get that ooey gooey yummy in my tummy feeling.

- Junior burrito: Let us get one thing straight: these kinds of places KNOW how to do burritos. No it ain't like Chipotle and it ain't like Taco Bell. This is the place where they stuff your burrito TO THE MAX. I had to order the junior because I can't even finish a regular sized burrito (I know I'm weaksauce). But hot daaaaamn. The beef is so good with the rice, black beans (you get to choose your meat and beans) salsa, lettuce, and the wrap. Ugh and you get a side of chips also, which are actually made fresh and slipped into a basket. Whooooey.

It's spacious, and there's a salsa bar where you can grab your own salse. Downside is that it's cash only. And the place looks so bleek inside.

Be prepared to unbutton your pants and sit back afterwards. Baaaaam.
author: Jerianne G.

description: Just order this off of Postmates n what a huge disappointment. Got a Oder of cold hard fires. Definitely weren't fresh. An order of super nachos that were really soggy. They did come with extra chips on the side. The real problem was that there was hardly any shredded chicken n lots n lots of this liquid guacamole n sour cream. Same problem with the super quesadilla. Came out to $25. Biggest waste of money in recent memory
author: Paul G.

description: I always order from uber eats, I have called numerous times to confirm my order they always manage to get it wrong... they need to start reading orders I would give this restaurant a 0 stars... never again.... I gave them a last chance but always manage to get it wrong
author: Fatima R.

description: Okay, I take it all back. After coming back several times, this place is A+. For less than $9, you get a super burrito larger than any other I've ever seen or had in the city, including La Taqueria, Vallarta, Cancun, etc. It's not just cheaper and larger; these burritos are packed with meat and beans, and the quality of meat is also A+. I think the first time I came was an anomaly because every time after that, I've had the same excellent service, but way better quality food. I really could go on and on about the great, free salsa bar, speed of the single cook in the back, or lack of hygiene, which lets you know it's good, in this place. But in all honesty, I will be coming back often for that deliciously packed carnitas super burritos, which isn't soggy or scant.
author: Danny C.

description: Worst EVER!! First visit I got something I didn't even order. Not even an apology. Paid for it but didn't eat it! Second visit today, June 23, ordered the taco salad with Chile Verde asked for black beans got pinto beans. There was no verde sauce , just little cubes of REALLY TOUGH meat. So much lettuce that I think I got a whole head. They should close !!!
author: Gary R.

description: Tried them for the first time, mainly because there was no fee on door dash. Was pretty good. An the price wasn't bad. Got the enchilada plate, was only $8 some thing. Pretty good deal.
author: David C.

description: Torta was good, super quesadilla was good, chips and salsa were good.... I like it because I can order via uber eats BUT I've gotten a cold quesadilla 1/3 times and they are literally 5 blocks away from me
author: John O.

description: The best late night food! I had the super nachos with carne asada to go. It was fast and cheap ($6.). The chips are packed separately so they don't get soggy. The carne was tender, beans and rice were terrific!
author: Ha D.

description: Love love love! Large burritos and great customer service. Meat is seasoned and flavorful. This place keeps me coming back. My new staple taqueria!!
author: Omar H.

description: I'v always come here great burritos. They are huge so it was a frequent for me and my friends. Everyone that works there is nice but the salsa bar runs out of stuff often! I won't be back to this place because I found a Tapatio cap in my burrito! Took a bite thinking it was cartilage. If they aren't carful enough to see that before wrapping it up or to keep it away from the food who knows what else is in my burrito. FAIL.
author: Jennifer F.

description: I ordered a steak burrito with exactly ONE modification: no beans. What did I get? A burrito with ONLY beans and rice. A waste of my god damn money. It's not hard to mess up Mexican food unless you're completely incompetent. Will never order from this restaurant again.
author: Philip K.

description:
Don't get fooled by the looks of the place out the loud TV... This tacos are among the best, the very best I have tried out of Mexico! The camaron taco is a must, and the tacos dorados are delicious ++.

I found my SF mex place, a lot to say here.
author: Krito R.

description:
This place is awsome they have Great burritos! !!!!! Great tacos.... and Cervezas! !!!

Viva La iguana
author: Leo O.

description:
Pretty good portions. The burritos are always tasty and sloppy and I think they're a bit cheaper than the surrounding/competing tacquerias near Cayuga. 

They aren't anything super special but it sure isn't a bad second choice to a place like el farolito in the mission or La tacqueria. I'd recommend it to locals just looking for a convenient mission style burrito. Don't get the chicken burrito here tho, they're really bland and the plates seem a but smaller in portion compared to other places.
author: Terence Y.

description: BRING BACK THE OLD COOK!!!!!! The food is super bland and boring now.  I see they fired all the old staff and this young boy at the register I ordered one sopes and one tortas he tried to over charge me because I had a $50 in my hand. My boyfriend had to argue with him to fix it because he kept saying that's what you ordered like we said something wrong. I understand you have a hard time speaking and understanding  English but when the prices are on the menu it's pretty simple. I will not go there ever again and it makes me angry.
author: Diamond N.

description: I was hungry for something to eat.. So I walk into this place and saw beef tongue and stomach meat.. So I order 2 baby burritos..and ask for extra spicy.. Came home n start eating .... No spicy at all..but the tongue was so so tender n juicy.. For the size and price is still worth buying from here..
author: Crisy G.

description: Nachos were good, chicken was little burnt in the tacos.
author: Sahil B.

description: I have seen this place change a little bit here and there and wondering if there were new owners. A while ago my friend dragged me in here to grab some food and I got the tacos. I loved their tacos and so far friends and family that come here give given good reviews so I wanted to update my yelp review, I would recommend!
author: Miray V.

description: Good prices for huge burritos (a standard is $7 and probably 1300 calories), good horchata and great salsa. The burrito itself was fairly mediocre, but everything else made it a good experience. Also, chill staff.
author: Sheridan G.

description:
There are a lot of taquerias in San Francisco, most them are pretty good, some are spectacular, THIS PLACE IS NOT ONE OF THEM!
 Lousy service, mediocre food at best and a bit over priced, especially for the quality. If you are craving a taqueria I suggest you go somewhere else.
author: schmoo l.

description: I love this place.  So many of the reviews say that the food is great but service sucks.  I've yet to have bad service and I've been about 10 times.  They are always busy and maybe that translates to poor service to some people, but i love this place. Their chile relleno burritos are the best.
author: Patrick W.

description: My friends and I always go together to eat out and Taqueria La Iguana Azul is one of our favorites! Their burritos are GREAT.
author: Rubii N.

description:
This place was heading into 4 star territory but a couple of hiccups near the end of my dining experience bumped it down to a 3.

I ordered a super burrito with a spinach tortilla. meat, black beans, salsa, sour cream, guac, the youge.

Best part is the meat, lots of meat in the burrito can't complain about that.

Room for improvement: 2 areas stick out to me. 
1st) service is slow after order. not snail pace, but slower than most taquerias I go too. It's good, but I don't think the delay in time is fully reflected in the final dish.

2) The wrapping fell apart halfway through. For the time they take to make things I thought the wrapping would be better. It was a long burrito and maybe it should have been shorter and fatter because at a certain point i took a bite and both ends opened up. that's a burrito wrapping faux pas my Iguana friends.

The wrapping and not as quick as usual burrito making bumped it down for me. I also had a stomach ache after I ate here but I am not sure if it was what I Drank which I did not puchase here or the burrito or a mix. 

I read an earlier review about cash only. They do take CREDIT CARD now. If I had no preference on style I would probably go to Phillies next door, but this is a good option for a burrito and I even saw a Phillies worker in line after me.
author: Glenn M.

description: The beat shrimp tacos in town...Hands down .. Fast service...Friendly employees...Very close to public transportation
author: L P.

description: I used to go here all the time and it used to be amazing but had been getting worse and worse. I stopped going altogether, and a few months later decided I would give it one more try. I spent $9 on a burrito that felt like it was literally only sour cream, it was just goopy. I couldn't eat it in a way that didn't make me look like a barbarian freak. The average bite temperature was cold because of how much sour cream/salsa there was. And it was ENORMOUS. Which would be a good thing if it was a good burrito, but now I have to keep this big floppy thing around wondering whether I can eat it or refrigerate it
author: Charlie T.

description:
Bomb ass steak nachos. Bomb ass steak burritos. 
Everyone that works there is friendly. 
And it is affordable. :)
I love this place so much that my boyfriend is now sick of it hahahah.
author: Lindsay L.

description: This is my neighborhood taqueria and I've been enjoying their food for years. The food is great, the people are nice they are open late. My favorites are the super burrito and shrimp super burrito. I love the quesadillas  and the chips. Good salsa too.
author: Fran S.

description: Not too shabby at all! Less than $7 gets you a freshly made Veggie burrito sans a ling wait around lunch time. Very clean place & friendly folks! Also full salsa bar.
author: R C.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE! you will disappointed, I guarantee you. 

 Sadly, I live just around the corner and this is my local taqueria.. but trust me, I will be walking the extra five blocks to Taqueria Menudo on Mission to avoid this place. 

 I grew up in this hood and was stoked to try this place a few years ago.. sadly, it was bad then and its only gotten worse. 1) customer service blows.. they get my order wrong each time (why i stopped going after third time) 2) the food actually taste worse than their customer service... rice is bland, meat lacks flavor at all :( 3) if they DO get your order wrong and you bring it back.. they want you to bring the burrito and your receipt so they can open up the burrito and see what they did wrong and only after trying to argue with you for five minutes on how they did it right and you were wrong.. will they finally give in and make you another (corrected) order.. NOT without trying to charge you first. 

 TRUST ME.. you don't want to go here.. Taqueria Menudo is up on Mission and Brazil (i believe) and it rocks socks.. SO don't be lazy like i was and walk down there.. its worth it.. trust. FYI: they have delicious carne asada fries!!
author: Amber M.

description:
I am a local, so this may be a biast review.  This review is also only for the Tostadas.  Ok now on to the review.

The people who work here are super friendly (I also conversate with them in Spanish, so I might get more love than you white people who walk in).  They are always talking to me, and bullshitting as I wait for my food.

I hit this joint up after work at least once a week for the tostadas.  The carnitas are probably the best I have had in the city thus far.  They are perfectly cooked masas de puerco that are later fried a little more to give it a crispy touch.

They dump a ton of dressing on the tostada; lettuce, avocados, salsa, sour cream, beans, tomatoes, the whole nine yards...oh yea and a HUGE portion of pork - carnitas.  

The best part, this meal is only $3.75.  Find me another place that has good, cheap food like that? Anyways, haven't tried anything else, if I do I will write another review.  Tostadas, check em out they are nice on your wallet.
author: Tom L.

description: Kid behind the reregister was too cool to answer any questions about the food. I ordered a super carna asada burrito there was more rice than anything and the guacamole was mostly salsa. Not a good place for burritos I recommend going somewhere else like 24th and mission.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Being in my neighborhood, I really wanted to like them. But, alas, they are pretty crappy. I ordered a super burrito from them and the entire burrito was cold. They didn't heat up the burrito after putting it together and the cheese and everything else tasted horrible. I also tried their carne asada torta. The carne asada was over done and tasteless. You can't do that when you have Farolito just a few blocks down.

The only upside was that I liked their grilled chicken. But that is not enough to hold up and entire taqueria. 

Sorry, Mr. Iguana. You just didn't make the cut.
author: L A.

description: Excellent food, never had a problem. Friendly staff and quick service, one thing they can work on is lowering the music volume, its really annoying when you try to place a to go order over the phone !!!
author: Kanish L.

description: Taco lovers, you've got to visita this place! Que comida ricaaaa oh my gawd! The best tacos in town, period. I had the Tacos Dorado's, amazing....
author: Cintia C.

description:
It's A-OK.  After meandering around my 'hood in the morning scavenging for some grub, I settled for this place because they happen to be open at this early hour of the morning.  Also, I didn't want breakfast burritos, I wanted real burritos for breakfast.  Their service was decent.  The chips didn't taste as fresh as I hoped.  Their vege burrito was fair.

Free Willy was showing on one of their TVs.  Other patrons and I watched the movie with amazement, but I could barely understand the movie dubbed in Spanish.  Maybe it's time I learn Spanish for good this time.
author: Archie L.

description: Got a super chicken burrito from here just now.  Place was kind of busy which I feel is a good sign.  From the last time I was here I noticed they added a bar counter towards the back of the restaurant and some flat screens.  The ingredients tasted fresh.  The salsa was not spicy at all but the guac salsa is.  Chips decent.  The lady at the counter was very nice.  I took away a star because of the way my burrito was made.  The burrito guy must be new because my burrito was loose and sloppy and not tightly rolled.  After the first bite, a few bites fell out of it.  The size of the super is consistent of El Faralito's which is huge.  I may give it a second chance now that I know they have carne asada fries.  I don't know if I will dine in though.  Most likely get food to go since they serve drinks and had a bunch of guys boozing in the back.  Definitely not a date place.
author: Chris S.

description: So good it's my favorite place to eat. Yummmm seriously go. Regular burrito, super burrito regular nachos super nachos. All the best
author: Doctor C.

description:
Blue Iguana you're the self-absorbed inattentive girl that lingers way too long on my mind. You're the girl that strings me along then shits on my heart. You are the one that shows me an ounce of affection and I love you all over again. 

After my two year hiatus from you while I was out in new york you have become even more ravishing than the first time I met you. 

I hate you, and I love you. You're my al pastor burrito once again.
author: Watty Y.

description: Great food, service and best of all it's open late. Thank you for the late night snack!
author: M R.

description: affordable prices .. comparing to other taquerias around the area .great flavor in the 10 inch super burrito .place no to spetacular they are very friendly .
author: Alfredo R.

description: Service was very slow. The place doesn't look like it gets cleaned very often. The music was too loud. But the food is tasty and the portions are huge.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Not the best place in the neighborhood, but they're open later than most others and the food is good enough to satisfy a craving. That said, I wouldn't go out of my way to find this place. The peeps behind the counter are friendly enough but not interested in chit chat. Know what you want before you step up to the counter and for God's sake people, the regular burrito does not come with cheese. Just like it says on the menu: rice, beans, salsa and choice of meat. You want cheese? Ask for it. Or better yet, get out of line and go to Taco Bell.

I've had the carne asada, chicken, but never been brave enough for the carnitas (deep fried pork). I usually pop in here around 10:00 p.m. and at that time of day the meat is usually a little dry and pretty salty. I have a high tolerance for salt so I love it, but friends have said it's too much. The guacamole is good and freshly made, but be warned, towards the end of the night they sometimes run out.

Good late night meal: One Regular Burrito with chicken, rice, black beans, and spicy salsa; one Tamarind soda; chips and a side of guacamole. This meal provides all the flavors one needs to end a meal: sweet, spicy, sour and savory. Though the flavors aren't always well-balanced, Taqueria La Iguana Azul has a few advantages: cheap and convenient.
author: Joshua R.

description:
The al pastor is probably their best meat. Avoid the chicken and vegetatrian options, they are just not tasty. The al pastor  super quesadilla is something else, savage one might say. They also do an interesting seafood soup, if you're into that kind of thing. 
And to top the list they do the best menudo ever. I have tried many places along mission and have yet to find a tastier Sunday hangover cure. Plus my dog Chopper loves the leftover bones. MMmmmmmmm Tripe.
You can also go in and have a few beers and watch about 3 different things on TV whilst listening to blaring shit music.... I love this place! The staff are well cool also, I think they are fairly amused at the fact that I regularly scoff menudo most Sundays.
Oh ya, you can also play Street Fighter while waiting for your tacos, lethal :)
author: Johnny N.

description: Avoid the chicken. I ordered chicken enchiladas, and what i got was bland and disgusting. There's so much better Mexican food in the area to  eat instead.
author: Carlos Z.

description:
I used to love Taqueria La Iguana's veggie burritos and delicious salsas when I still worked in the musty basement of a brokedown government building over in a nasty corner of the OMI/E neighborhood. I swear the only ray of sunshine penetrating those cinder block walls was the occasional surprise burrito from Taqueria La Iguana left on my desk by a thoughtful colleague (or stolen off the desk of a colleague stupid enough to leave a goldmine like this lying around). 

Since I've officially gained 15 lbs in about 6 months (ohh, being in love...), I can no longer (as of today) savor such greasy** delights...But at a meeting in a moderately less broken-down government building this afternoon, I was treated to several bites of one of their delicious suizas (chicken and cheese) and mounds of that delicious, fresh salsa, bringing me back to those miserable days in that godawful basement (if I worked with you there: don't take it personally!). And all at once, I was weeping tears of joy. For I CAN work in a clean high rise in the financial district and eat my Taqueria La Iguana, too. Doesn't get much better than that.

**EVERYTHING here is greasy. There is no such thing as "light", "low fat", or "low glycemic index/low impact carb/carb free/high protein/tasteslikecardboard" within these walls. Being a white woman from an upper middle class family, with the education and the body dysmorphic disorder to go with it, I must deduct one star.
author: Autumn K.

description:
I'm still hopeful that this restaurant will turn itself around, but so far I've only had bad experiences since they switch over to this new crew.

I had tongue taco on my mind after the great one I had at Mexico Tipico  last night so on my way to a job interview, I stopped off here because it was just across the street from the bus stop.

I ordered their taco plate special (3 tacos, any meat, beans, and rice) for $7.40.  The tacos come with guacamole, so I ordered sour cream.  

As soon as I got the plate, I knew I made a big mistake.  It damn near erased all my good feelings for tongue tacos.  The tongue was sour--I don't know what they did.  Was it the sauce they cooked the tongue in or the salsa or what?  Did they squeeze lime on the tongue to hide a greater evil? It was just nasty.

Other than it being sour, everything else was bland.  No snappiness. No freshness. No life. 

Even the guacamole they had advertised on the black board was disappointing... I mean, it wasn't even guacamolerized... it appeared as thin slices of avocado from maybe a regular slice of avocado... I shouldn't even call it food.  It was more like garnish.

I have to remind myself to remember "red dead sour" when I think of going in there again and ordering tongue.

If I had more time, I should have made the effort and taken the bus down and gotten the good tongue.  I would have pay for 2 really great tacos rather than 3 lousy tacos.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
I've been trying to write a review on this place for over a year now, but every time I step up to the plate (not to eat, it's a metaphorical term here) I can't figure out what to say: savory, creamy, greasy, lime soaked, daunting. 

Fact: I'm working basically a two to one unfinished for finished burritos here.

Being the proud owner of a compact but still quite roomy stomach I have never felt more ashamed then those days or afternoons or 2 am's where my hand still held a foil wrapped bundle of appealingly greasy, lime flavored chicken, black beans, cheese, crema mexicana, and avocado, but my belly said 'no more!'

Worse too, because these burritos are so damn good.

Fact: I've mentioned grease a couple times, that part is inescapable. Thankfully my beard never looks shinier than after a meeting with these burritos.

But the ratio does contain a few victories on my end and those are the moments that keep me coming back. Sure the food coma post-burrito prevents one from doing anything. But sometimes finishing one of these monsters is the high point of my day, why bother pretending.
author: Stephen M.

description:
Greasy is right. My super suiza quesadilla was oozing oil and cheese out of its little plastic basket even before I touched it. 

Portions were big, but perhaps it was the huge amount of cheese that made it so filling. 

Regular vs. super burritos and quesadillas is a difference of salsa, guac, and sour cream added and not a size difference.

Love that they have avocado salsa in addition to the regular red salsa and pico de gallo. 

Cash only.
author: Jenny L.

description:
"Greasy gut-busting love torpedoes."

 If this appeals to you as a description of a burrito then you will love this place. If it repulses you, then you won't. Simple.
author: Joe S.

description: Eat here for lunch quite often. I'm from the mission so I know good taqueria's and this place is pretty good. The prices and food are decent compared to other taqueria's in the city, but the place is kinda grimy inside. The burritos are pretty big and juicy, not dry or stingy at all. Genuine taqueria spot that gives complimentary chips, salsa, and jalapenos :)
author: Patrick L.

description:
THEY HAVE THE LOUDEST BILINGUAL JUKE BOX EVER!
 Even though I got my burrito togo, I had to listen to this while I waited. There are sports on 2 TVs, and a massive beverage selection. My burrito was huge- seriously it could feed a family of four.
The meat was a little to salty, the rice was a bit dry, but it was OK. If I were a big hungry dude, I might come here for the sheer size of the portions.
author: Melissa B.

description:
Pros:  Wallet friendly, fast, large and tasty, burritos, beverage selection is huge (frescas are awesome), and they're open late.

Cons:  Not as much meat in their burritos as before, but decent, and the ambiance could be better, but that isn't so important if you're craving a burrito.
author: Randy M.

description: Good burrito not much to improve with the food.  The place itself could use a bit of an overhaul, definitely a dive.
author: Ryan H.

description:
I swore they used to have bbq chicken burritos! UGH.


I ate here when I was in high school and ordered their bbq chicken burritos (which were bomb, btw). I just recently brought my bf thinking that they were STILL serving them, but noooo. No more bbq chicken on the menu. =T We settled with buying a couple things anyway and I was even more disappointed..Me No Likey! 


Uh Uhh...why the heck would you erase bbq chicken from your menu!? In other words, I'm hella mad.
author: Cheryl P.

description:
average food. definitely not worth a special trip. i go here once in a while because it's open late, next to my house, and consistently okay.

one thing they have going for them is their drink selection. all kinds of crazy drinks you wouldn't find at a safeway, that's for sure.

if you're itching for mexican food and are mobile, make a quick trip to La Corneta in Glen Park. They have way better food over there, though it's a bit more expensive.
author: Tyler b.

description: My favorite spot to go to after work! Plus it is convinient because it is near my house but the burritos are cheap, the tacos are great..I love the lengua! I bet they may get thrown off from time to time when i ask for no beans on my burrito but they make it work and I appreciate them for it a lot. They always give plenty of meat and during the weekends they have menudo. If anything i haven't tried the sandwiches and fried fish but I love the tripe..very gelatenus....I appreciate what is considered the bad stuff from animals..it's greatness to me hahaha, then again i'm filipino so I grew up on the stuff :)
author: John G.

description: I stopped by there cause I saw the lunch special.  A regular burrito for only $4.50.  There is also other specials on certain days, but I normally just get their burritos.  I recently saw a special for Friday for tacos for like around $6 dollars.  (I think),  I think I might go by there and try that one day.  Their food is pretty good, a few occasion, the burrito got cold when I got home, but 30 seconds in the microwave, just as good.  And it's pretty filling for a regular burrito.  If you are a big guy, like my boyfriend, I would get him the Super, with beef.  I just order the vegetarian.
author: Jenny W.

description:
not only are there your standard burritos and tacos, but they have different meat dinner dishes, enchiladas, soups, and mexican breakfast options.

i've tried different veggie items: tacos, burritos, breakfast burritos, tostada salad...  the food is decent.  i wouldn't say it's the best taqueria, but if you're on geneva and don't feel like venturing north on mission to the mecca of taquerias, then this place should suffice.
author: Sheri N.

description: I don't get all the weak reviews here. I've eaten here off and on since '05 or '06, when it was always blue iguana and have never had a bad burrito/taco. It's not ritzy but I've always had a solid burrito. Their carnitas is a little heavier and chewier than Guadalajara's down the road, but the salsa verde is a little better. It's a solid local legitimate authentic taqueria. If you don't like it you probably eat at Chipotle.
author: Chris R.

description: This place isn't bad. They have Heineken on tap and the pollo asado is decent. The salsa is prety good, and I kind of like the vibe here. I wouldn't recommend the wet burrito however, the mole wasn't very good and it was just greasy and gross. I seldom end up going here  since Taqueria Guadalajara is equidistant from my apartment, and much better in my opinion, but once in awhile I'll duck in here to change it up.
author: Brian H.

description: Good burrito, great size, but the meat was a little tough. Major props for being open later than other nearby ones and taking credit cards. Although I didn't see they took credit cards until I'd already paid in cash for my $7.05 burrito with $8, getting back 95 cents of change.
author: Mark A.

description: Well I eat here often and they have fast service and good tacos.
author: Dee Z.

description: This place totally rocked when it was Taqueria Maria, but now not so much.  I don't know what happened.  I guess the cook must have left when the business was sold.  Their rice is awful, it's actually crunchy.  rice should never be crunchy.  Their beans taste like they came straight out of a can and their tortillas are just blah.  I make better burritos at home.
author: Erica N.

description: It's rough when you like a place, then they change owners and the place goes down hill like a speeding roller coaster ending up in a mess of twisted metal at the bottom of the hill. That is what I feel like has happened to this place. It used to be a great place to go get a burrito, now it is just disgusting.
author: Martha M.

description: best burrito place in san francisco. i've been here 200 - 300 times in my life.
author: Greg P.

description: It used to be so much better when it was Taqueria Maria... then they changed owners and our taco guy left. :-( since then it has really gone down hill. The meat is dry and chewy. although if you do decide to go there becuase you're starving and can't go anywhere else make sure you try the green salsa. it is the best! so for that i'll give them 2 stars! :o)
author: Jessica S.

description: Huge gigantic burrito, about 3 pounds, one of the biggest in town and big screen sports. Good if you are hungry and want to watch baseball and listen to loud mexican music on the jukebox simultaneously. One of my favorite things to do. Good if you are looking for a filling average tasting burrito, not so good if you are looking for a better tasting burrito. Closest "better tasting" burrito to this place is Taqueria Guadalajara at the corner of Mission and Onondaga, three blocks down Mission. They have big screen soccer and a fantastic tasting 2 pound super beef  burrito. But no baseball.
author: mark g.

description: I have been eating at Iguana Azul (formerly Taqueria Maria) since it opened when I was a little girl. They have my favorite veggie burrito of anywhere I've ever been. Something about the cheese.....anyway people are dumb if they don't like it. Go to some yuppie spot!
author: unknown u.

description: love this place normally meet friends in the area and end up eating here... damn stake quasidella is the shit... man what else to say... only Mexican restraint that dont give me the runs...
author: Ernesto E.

description: Ok people, I LOVE this place.  Not only are they walking distance from my house, they are open really really late.  Well most of the time they are.  I always used to get the super grilled chicken burrito with everything, but then my sister in law got the burrito mojado ( a burrito covered in enchilada sauce) and i love that too.  But  i like to hold my burrito in my hands and eat it, rather than cut it up with a knife and fork.  SOmething just isnt right about that.....Anyhow, THEN i decided to try the chicken quesadilla, and omg, there is nothing better than a flour grilled tortilla with massive amounts of cheese, lots of chicken, and guacamole and sour cream.....too bad i am lactose intolerant, and eating it all made my stomach cramp up like i just ate a piece of raw chicken by accident, but the stomach pains were well worth the cheesy goodness of a quesadilla.  Oh and they give you tortilla chips  and theres a regular salsa bar with your standard salsas as well.  I like this place and i like to tell my friends and coworkers about it.
author: Janet R.
